items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Dan Moser, Interim SuperintendentSUBJECT:Excuse Absence of Board President Garcia from June 17 and June 22, 2010, Board MeetingsThe District has been informed that Board President Eddie Garcia is ill, that he required hospitalization, and that he was absent from the June 17 Board meeting and will be absent from the June 22 meeting due to his illness.  Per Education Code section 35120(c), a Board member who is absent from a meeting may receive his/her monthly stipend if the Board adopts a resolution finding that the Board member was absent due to illness.Funding Source:General FundFiscal Impact:$750Recommendation: Administration recommends that the Board resolve and find that Mr. Garcia's absence was due to his illness and that the Board excuse his absence from the June 17 and June 22, 2010, Board meetings.

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTResolution in Support of the California Jobs BudgetResolution #2009/2010-52WHEREAS, California is again facing a huge deficit: a $17.9 billion general fund shortfall.  The ongoing gap in revenues and spending continues to place an undue burden on educators, and threatens to compromise the quality of public education in the state; and WHEREAS, other state budget proposals threaten more than 430,000 private sector, school and local government jobs, while cutting $4.3 billion in Proposition 98 spending to schools and childcare programs; andWHEREAS, the California Jobs Budget, introduced by Assembly Speaker John A. PĂŠrez, takes a radically different approach toward resolving the state’s budget deficit by creating and saving jobs while closing the deficit.  The California Jobs Budget includes a $10.1 billion jobs and economic stability fund that will protect against the loss of these jobs; andWHEREAS, the California Jobs Budget protects public school funding.  The California Jobs Budget rejects the $4.3 billion in Proposition 98 cuts found in other budget proposals and instead fully funds the state’s constitutional requirement; and  WHEREAS, the California Jobs Budget will ensure that $3.8 billion would be repaid to local school districts.  This protects tens of thousands of jobs for teachers, aides and counselors—a step which is good for the local community and the local business community.NOW THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED that the East Side Union High School District supports the California Jobs Budget as proposed, and encourages the State Legislature and the Governor to adopt this budget without delay.  PASSED AND ADOPTED this 22nd day of June 2010 by the Governing Board of the East Side Union High School District at its Regular Meeting held at 830 N. Capitol Avenue, San Jose, State of California. AYES:   ________NOES:  ________ABSENT:  ______ABSTAIN:  ______I certify the foregoing resolution was duly introduced, passed, and adopted by the East Side Union High School District Board of Trustees at a meeting held on June 22, 2010._________________________ClerkESUHSD Board of Trustees

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Dan Moser, Interim SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and InstructionSUBJECT:Discussion and/or Action Change in Governance and Operations ofLCPA to the NHU FoundationOn April 16, 2010, National Hispanic University was sold to the Laureate Education Group and will operate under the name of The National Hispanic University LLC.  The existing entity, National Hispanic University, has changed its name to The NHU Foundation.  The Foundation will continue to administer Latino College Preparatory Academy.The NHU Foundation has requested that the original petition be modified to list NHU Foundation as the entity directly responsible for operations and governance of Latino College Preparatory Academy.The request by NHU Foundation is a non-substantial change to the original petition and is viewed as beneficial to the long-term success of Latino College Preparatory Academy.FISCAL IMPACT:N/AFUNDING SOURCE:N/ARECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the change in governance and operations of LCPA to the NHU Foundation.

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Dan Moser, Interim SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business ServicesSUBJECT:Accept Warrant Register for the Month of May 2010Attached is a list of warrants issued during the month of May 2010 in response to Board Policy 3314 Payment for Goods and Services adopted by the Board in May 2009.   The Policy states that, “The Board shall approve all warrants (checks) at a regularly scheduled Board meeting.”   While there is no legal requirement for Board approval of issued warrants, this list and future lists will add to the "transparency” of District business.   The legal authorization for an expense comes prior to the issuance of the warrants when the Board approves purchase orders, contracts and other authorized expenses as per Board Policies.FISCAL IMPACT:Not ApplicableFUNDING SOURCE:Not ApplicableRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended the Board of Trustees accept the Warrant Register for the Month of May 2010.

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT                                                       AMENDEDTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Dan Moser, Interim SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business ServicesSUBJECT:Approve Contracts for Professional Services over $50,000The following Contracts for Professional Services over $50,000 is being recommended for Board approval.1.  Anodyne Professional Development Systems, Inc. Reviewed by:Contract PeriodCost/Fund SourceSchool/Dept. ManagerRobert IbarraDonna BertrandOctober 1, 2009 through and including August 31, 2012$99,000.00 (for the full term of the contract)Teaching American HistoryRobert Ibarra, Coordinator of Professional DevelopmentEast Side Union High School District (ESUHSD) is requesting authorization from the Board of Trustees to approve an Approve Contract Services Agreement with Teachers’ Anodyne Professional Development Systems, Inc. for the Term October 1, 2009 through and including August 31, 2012 for the provision of evaluation services to East Side Union High School District U.S. History Teachers during Summer Institutes and to delegate authority to the Interim Superintendent or designee to amend said contract on an as needed basis, including funding.Reason for the Purchase of Outside ServicesIn 2009 ESUHSD submitted a competitive grant application in response to the Teaching American History Grant program.  The Teaching American History Gran Program is a discretionary grant program funded under Title II-C, Subpart 4 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act. The goal of the program is to support programs that raise student achievement by improving teachers' knowledge, understanding, and appreciation of American history.  The program is designed to raise student achievement by improving teachers' knowledge and understanding of and appreciation for traditional U.S. history. Grant awards will assist LEAs, in partnership with entities that have content expertise, to develop, document, evaluate, and disseminate innovative and cohesive models of professional development. By helping teachers to develop a deeper understanding and appreciation of U.S. history as a separate subject matter within the core curriculum, these programs will improve instruction and raise student achievement.Selection Process Prior to submitting the grant application, ESUHSD did not do any type of solicitation/bidding process. Professional Development went with a local (California) evaluation service provider with a long track record of co-authoring and securing Teaching American History competitive grants.  However, in the future, all efforts will be made to do a competitive solicitation process, when necessary, prior to writing grants that name specific providers in the grant application.RECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Contract Services Agreement with Anodyne Professional Development Systems, Inc. for the Term October 1, 2009 through and including August 31, 2012 for the provision of evaluation services to East Side Union High School District U.S. History Teachers during Summer Institutes and to delegate authority to the Interim Superintendent or designee to amend said contract on an as needed basis, including funding.   2.  Teachers’ Curriculum Institute (TCI)  Reviewed by:Contract PeriodCost/Fund SourceSchool/Dept. ManagerRobert IbarraDonna BertrandOctober 1, 2009 through and including August 31, 2012$301,000.00 (for the full term of the contract)Teaching American HistoryRobert Ibarra, Coordinator of Professional DevelopmentEast Side Union High School District (ESUHSD) is requesting authorization from the Board of Trustees to approve an Approve Contract Services Agreement with Teachers’ Curriculum Institute (TCI) for the Term October 1, 2009 through and including August 31, 2012 for professional development and standards-based instructional materials to East Side Union High School District U.S. History Teachers during Summer Institutes and to delegate authority to the Interim Superintendent or designee to amend said contract on an as needed basis, including funding. Reason for the Purchase of Outside ServicesIn 2009 ESUHSD submitted a competitive grant application in response to the Teaching American History Grant program.  The Teaching American History Gran Program is a discretionary grant program funded under Title II-C, Subpart 4 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act. The goal of the program is to support programs that raise student achievement by improving teachers' knowledge, understanding, and appreciation of American history.  The program is designed to raise student achievement by improving teachers' knowledge and understanding of and appreciation for traditional U.S. history. Grant awards will assist LEAs, in partnership with entities that have content expertise, to develop, document, evaluate, and disseminate innovative and cohesive models of professional development. By helping teachers to develop a deeper understanding and appreciation of U.S. history as a separate subject matter within the core curriculum, these programs will improve instruction and raise student achievement.Selection Process In submitting the competitive grant application, ESUHSD included specific providers who would assist ESUHSD in fulfilling the grant requirements. TCI was named in the Grant Proposal as a sole provider of professional development and curriculum materials.  TCI has designed this material specifically around ESUHSD’s Social Studies State standards and multiple learning styles.  No other provider is able to furnish ESUHSD the products and professional development services that TCI can provide to ESUHSD’s teachers.  Therefore, TCI is considered to be a “sole-source” provider for this project.RECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Contract Services Agreement with Teachers’ Curriculum Institute for the Term October 1, 2009 through and including August 31, 2012 for professional development and standards-based instructional materials to East Side Union High School District U.S. History Teachers during Summer Institutes and to delegate authority to the Interim Superintendent or designee to amend said contract on an as needed basis, including funding.3. WEST intends to use the Swimming Pool Facilities for organized and supervised swim and water polo practices; physical conditioning; swim instruction; parking for participants’ vehicles; meetings; swim meets, swim fundraisers and swim competitions; and storage.  Swim meets, fundraisers and competitions will be covered under separate agreements.The parties may add additional Swimming Pool Facilities by a written addendum to this License and the primary use of the Swimming Pool Facilities shall remain with the ESUHSD.Negotiated Rates:Regular Use Fee for Independence High School (“IHS”)July 1, 2010 – September 30, 2011:  $ 55 per hourOctober 1, 2011:  $ 56.65 per hour (includes a 3% COLA)October 1, 2012:  $ 58.35 per hour (includes a 3% COLA)Regular Use Fee for the 2nd High School (currently the pool is Evergreen Valley High School):July 1, 2010 through September 30, 2010:  $ 1,200October 1, 2010 through September, 2011: $ 1,854 (includes a 3% COLA)October 1, 2011 through September, 2012: $ 2,472 (includes a 3% COLA)October 1, 2012 through September, 2013: $3,090 (includes a 3% COLA)RECOMMENDATION: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve a Facilities License Agreement with West Coast Aquatics, Inc. for the Agreement of term of July 1, 2010 through and including September 30, 2013 for the non-exclusive use of Swimming Pool Facilities at East Side Union High School District Sites and to authorized the Interim Superintendent/ Superintendent or designee to modify such Agreement during the term as needed. The original bid was completed and awarded by Santa Rita’s Board of Trustees at their December 15, 2005 Board Meeting to American Modular Systems (AMS).  The contract with AMS has been renewed each year after that.  The current extension goes through December 31, 2010.However, to ensure that ESUHSD is receiving the best pricing ESUHSD did a comparison of other piggyback bids and the results are as follows:American Modular SystemsMobile ModularWilliams Scotsman$147,860.00$165,000.00$210,000.00RECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the purchase of one 12x40 DSA Approved Modular Restroom/ Concession Building in the amount of $147,000.00 from American Modular Sytems through the use of the Santa Rita Union School District’s piggyback bid (in accordance with Public Contract Code 20118 & 20118.2).  14.  AMS.NET  Reviewed by:Contract PeriodCost/Fund SourceSchool/Dept. ManagerAlan GarofaloJerry KurrDonna BertrandN/A$224,228.04 (increase amount) Measure E FundsDennis Barbata, DirectorEast Side Union High School District (ESUHSD) is requesting authorization from the Board of Trustees to approve Changed Order #1 to Purchase Order #001320 with AMS.NET in the amount of $224,288.04 for the completion of the Network Infrastructure Upgrade and Telecommunications Systems and to delegate authority to the Interim Superintendent to modify Purchase Order as needed, including funding.In the Summer of 2009 ESUHSD conducted a public Request for Proposal (RFP) process (RFP-04-08-09) where AMS.Net was awarded by the Board of Trustee’s at the September 17, 2009 Board meeting approved Administration’s recommendation to award the RFP to AMS.NET.  The original amount of the award was for $9,539,744.59.This Change Order #1 is needed in order for the current projects to be completed.  AMS.NET and CISCO have agreed to provide ESUHSD with the same pricing that we received from the competitive RFP process completed back in the summer 2009.  In an attempt to try and capture the entire list of components that would be necessary for a project the size of ESUHSD’s was quite a task.  It took ESUHSD months to come up with the plan on how this project would be completed.  Once the planning was completed, the identification of the many parts and pieces was conducted and the RFP documents were prepared and sent out.  It was not until after the award of the project when the Vendor and ESUHSD staff were conducting the various site walks and after the project has begun did ESUHSD and the Vendor realize how much was accidentally left off of the RFP parts list.  Some were missing parts and some were missing locations that were inadvertently left off.  ESUHSD waited until the project was at least half way completed before coming back to the Board to request one final Change Order to the Purchase Order. It was our intention to use all extra parts, if any, before requesting the Board to approve the purchase of any additional items under the RFP-04-08-09. Therefore the change we are requesting is $224,288.04. The new total for this Purchase Order will be $9,763,972.63. This amount includes all taxes, labor and parts needed to complete this project. For a project this size, the discrepancy is minimal.RECOMMENDATION:Approve Changed Order #1 to Purchase Order #001320 with AMS.NET in the amount of $224,288.04 for the completion of the Network Infrastructure Upgrade and Telecommunications Systems and to delegate authority to the Interim Superintendent to modify Purchase Order as needed, including funding.  15. ManagerCarole HersomCathy GiammonaDonna BertrandJuly 1, 2010 through and including June 30, 2011To be determineTuition – Special EducationCarole Hersom, Coordinator of Special ServicesThe East Side Union High School District is requesting authorization from the Board of Trustees to approve the Santa Clara County SELPAs Master Contract For Non Public, Non Sectarian School/Agency Services for 2010-2011 School Year; To Authorize the Interim Superintendent to amend side contracts on an as needed basis including funding. On an annual basis the members of South East Special Education Local Plan Area( SELPA), which East Side Union High School is a member, reviews the District Master Contract General Agreement for Nonsectarian, Nonpublic School/Agency services.  As the designated Local Education Agency ("LEA") East Side Union High School District is required to enter into Contracts with Vendors who provide special education and/or related services to individuals with disabilities under the authorization of Education Code Sections 56157, and 56365-56366.7.  It is understood that this Contract does not commit LEA to payment for special education and related services provided to any individual unless and until an Individual Service Agreement (ISA) for Nonpublic, Nonsectarian School/Agency (NPS/NPA) Services is executed between LEA and CONTRACTOR on behalf of such individual or interim telephone approval is given to the CONTRACTOR by a representative of LEA.The contract document was reviewed by counsel that has been retained by the Special Education Department, Mcarthur & Levin LLPSelection Process No solicitation process has taken place either at the initiation of this Contract nor at this time.  Students are referred and placed to alternative schools based on IEP hearings.  ESUHSD is required to pay the school portion of the placement.  Therefore, no solicitation process can take place for these types of placements.RECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the Santa Clara County SELPAs Master Contract For Non Public, Non Sectarian School/Agency Services for 2010-2011 School Year; and to Authorize the Interim Superintendent to amend side contracts on an as needed basis, including funding.

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Dan Moser, Interim SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Alan Garofalo, Associate Superintendent of Student Services and Facilities, and June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and PlanningSUBJECT:Approve the Plan for a Dedicated Central Services Building at Overfelt Adult CenterThe Board of Trustees considered the program plan for the Overfelt Adult Center in its meeting of June 17, 2010. The focus of the plan is a service delivery model that centralizes core services in a dedicated facility at the Overfelt Adult Education Center. This will broaden the Programs’ ability to deliver services more efficiently to the entire community.In order to provide the necessary classroom spaces to accommodate the Board approved educational program plan for the Overfelt Adult Center, dedicated facilities will need to be built on the existing site. The scope of work for the dedicated facilities will include new construction, limited demolition, and site work. The scope of work will be within the budget originally presented to the Board in February, 2009.The Facilities Bond Team will be present to answer questions from the Board of Trustees.FISCAL IMPACT:$13,183,408.00FUNDING SOURCE:Measure ERECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the proposed dedicated facilities plan and budget for the Overfelt Adult Center and for administration to proceed with the planning and construction efforts as appropriate.

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Dan Moser, Interim SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business ServicesSUBJECT:Approve Piggyback Bid AwardsThe following Piggyback bids are recommended for approval:1.  Furniture, Fixtures and EquipmentPIGGYBACK – Contrax Furnishings; Contract #R4976 Project Description:  For the continued procurement of furniture, fixtures and equipment for projects that are being completed under various funding sources.  Contrax Furnishings offers a wide variety of products and expertise. Such items includes but not limited to administrative, cafeteria, classroom, early childhood, music education, media centers, technology, and specialty products.  Awarding Agency:  The Cooperative Purchasing Network (TCPN) Award Date: January 15, 2009 and expires on April 30, 2011 with the ability to renew for three additional years.FISCAL IMPACT:VariousFUNDING SOURCE:VariousRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees award the use of this piggyback bid (in accordance with Public Contract Code 20118 & 20118.2) from The Cooperative Purchasing Network (TCPN). The TCPN bid will allow for the continued procurement of furniture, fixtures and equipment for the 2010-11 school year.  There are no fees to ESUHSD for using this contract.2.  Furniture, Fixture and EquipmentPIGGYBACK – Virco Inc.; Contract #0204011Project Description:  For the procurement of furniture, fixtures and equipment for projects that are being completed under various funding sources.    Awarding Agency: US CommunitiesAward Date: 	Original award was March 10, 2003; rebid and new award January 7, 2009 and expires on December 31, 2011.FISCAL IMPACT:VariousFUNDING SOURCE:VariousRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees award the use of this piggyback bid (in accordance with Public Contract Code 20118 & 20118.2) from US Communities. The US Communities bid will allow for the procurement of furniture, fixtures and equipment for the 2010-11 school year.  There are no fees to ESUHSD for using this contract.3.  Office/School SuppliesPIGGYBACK – Office DepotProject Description:  For the procurement of on-going office and instructional supplies.    Awarding Agency:  US Communities, Contract No. 42595Award Date: January 1, 2006 and expires on December 31, 2012.FISCAL IMPACT:VariousFUNDING SOURCE:VariousRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees award the use of this piggyback bid (in accordance with Public Contract Code 20118 & 20118.2) from US Communities. The US Communities bid will allow for the procurement of office and instructional supplies for the  2010-11 school year.  There are no fees to ESUHSD for using this contract.4.  Computer Hardware PIGGYBACK – Dell Computer Products; Contract #B27160Project Description:  The ESUHSD will need to procure computer equipment, software, peripherals, and related services for the 2010-11 school year. Awarding Agency:  Western States Contracting Alliance (WSCA)/The National Association of State Procurement Officials (NASPO) Award Date:  September 1, 2009 and expires on August 31, 2012. The agreement may be renewed for two years, through August 31, 2014, unless terminated pursuant to the terms of this Agreement.  FISCAL IMPACT:VariousFUNDING SOURCE:VariousRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees award the use of this piggyback bid (in accordance with Public Contract Code 20118 & 20118.2) from WSCA/NASPO.  The WSCA/NASPO bid will allow for the procurement of computer equipment, software, peripherals, and related services for the 2010-11 school year.  There are no fees to ESUHSD for using this contract.5. Computer Hardware PIGGYBACK – Apple, Inc.; Contract #B27158Project Description:  The ESUHSD will need to procure computer equipment, software, peripherals, and related services for the 2010-11 school year.    Awarding Agency:  Western States Contracting Alliance (WSCA)/The National Association of State Procurement Officials (NASPO) Award Date: September 1, 2009 and expires on August 31, 2012. The agreement may be renewed for two years, through August 31, 2014, unless terminated pursuant to the terms of this Agreement.  FISCAL IMPACT:VariousFUNDING SOURCE:VariousRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees award the use of this piggyback bid (in accordance with Public Contract Code 20118 & 20118.2) from WSCA/NASPO.  The WSCA/NASPO bid will allow for the procurement of computer equipment, software, peripherals, and related services for the 2010-11 school year.  There are no fees to ESUHSD for using this contract.6.  Industrial Supplies& Equipment, Lighting Products, Janitorial Supplies & EquipmentPIGGYBACK – Grainger; Contract #7066Project Description:  The ESUHSD will need to procure industrial supplies & equipment, lighting products, and janitorial supplies & equipment for the 2010-11 school year.    Awarding Agency: Western States Contracting Alliance (WSCA)Award Date: December 18, 2005 and expires on November 30, 2010.FISCAL IMPACT:VariousFUNDING SOURCE:VariousRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees award the use of this piggyback bid (in accordance with Public Contract Code 20118 & 20118.2) from WSCA. The WSCA bid will allow for the procurement of industrial supplies & equipment, lighting products, and janitorial supplies & equipment for the 2010-11 school year.  There are no fees to ESUHSD for using this contract.7.  Maintenance and Hardware SuppliesPIGGYBACK – Home Depot; Contract #05091Project Description:  The ESUHSD will need to procure maintenance and hardware supplies for the 2010-11 school year.    Awarding Agency:  US CommunitiesAward Date: December 1, 2005 and expires on November 30, 2011 FISCAL IMPACT:VariousFUNDING SOURCE:VariousRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees award the use of this piggyback bid (in accordance with Public Contract Code 20118 & 20118.2) from US Communities. The US Communities bid will allow for the procurement of maintenance and hardware supplies for the 2010-11 school year.  There are no fees to ESUHSD for using this contract.
